intro: Decaisnina parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved decaisnina, is a flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and produces white or pale pink flowers in clusters. It typically grows in heathland and coastal areas, preferring well-drained soils. Decaisnina parvifolia is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and adaptability to various garden conditions.
